channel.title: Adding a button to the SMF bar that opens a website
channel.description: Well, i got the button added, and i want it to open my wiki knowledge base, so i added hte url, but it opens it like this www.bashscape.info/smf/www.bashscape.info/knowledge/ How can i fix it?

item.title: Adding a button to the SMF bar that opens a website
item.dc:creator: @Songoty Songoty
item.description:
@Songoty wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:5, topic:175751”][quote author=Songoty link=topic=236376.msg2012395#msg2012395 date=1201216810]

I’m not exactly sure, but couldn’t you just do:

…/knowledge

The full URL Would then be, http://www.bashscape.info/smf/../knowledge

I put /knowledge for the whole thing,nothing infront, and it worked -.-
Weird lol.
But thank you.
[/quote]
it doesn’t work, because “/knowledge” is relative to the current path, which means it’d come out as http://www.bashscape.info/smf//knowledge
you’d have to change it to “…/knowledge”, or you could try putting in the absolute path, that’d mean entering “http://www.bashscape.info/knowledge”[/quote]
No, i acually just put /knowledge and it worked, and i did it agian with /status.php and it worked to. I thought it was weird because like you said, i thought that it should of opened within the SMF directory.

Read full topic
item.source: Adding a button to the SMF bar that opens a website

item.title: Adding a button to the SMF bar that opens a website
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Songoty, post:4, topic:175751”][quote author=eVokki` link=topic=236376.msg2012390#msg2012390 date=1201216420]
I’m not exactly sure, but couldn’t you just do:

…/knowledge

The full URL Would then be, http://www.bashscape.info/smf/../knowledge
[/quote]
I put /knowledge for the whole thing,nothing infront, and it worked -.-
Weird lol.
But thank you.[/quote]
it doesn’t work, because “/knowledge” is relative to the current path, which means it’d come out as http://www.bashscape.info/smf//knowledge
you’d have to change it to “…/knowledge”, or you could try putting in the absolute path, that’d mean entering “http://www.bashscape.info/knowledge”

Read full topic

well try saving the wiki page in the smf folder but in a new folder called ‘knowledge’ then change the url to /knowledge that might work
